definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Should pay attention to tighten hand braking and tucked the front wheels.
sentences.chinese: 要注意拉紧手制动和塞好前轮。

sentences.english: Floral printed blouse with hand made flowers trimmed as a brooch on chest.
sentences.chinese: 全印花上衣，胸前有手制立体花作胸针装饰。

sentences.english: The foot brake pedal and the hand brake are connected to the wheels too.
sentences.chinese: 脚制动和手制动是和车轮连接起来的。

sentences.english: Hand made flower trimmed as a brooch.
sentences.chinese: 胸位有手制立体花作饰针。

definition: to make ceramics (on a potter's wheel)
pineapple cake, traditional Taiwanese sweet pastry
a type of clay found in the region of Yixing 宜興|宜兴[Yi2 xing1], used to make Yixing stoneware, with its distinctive russet or dark purple coloring
to cure by drying over a fire (tea, meat etc)/to bake
bone china (fine white porcelain made from a mixture of clay and bone ash)
cookie (loanword via Cantonese 曲奇 kuk1 kei4)
